ogranichivayushchie-ubezhdeniya.title: Limiting Beliefs
ogranichivayushchie-ubezhdeniya.text:
1. Write down 5â€“10 phrases that often sound inside (insecurity, self-criticism).

Example: â€œI won't succeedâ€, â€œI'm lazyâ€

  1. Ask: â€œIs it true?â€, â€œIs there evidence to the contrary?â€
  2. Find an alternative thought and reformulate it into a supportive one.

Example: â€œI don't have time for anythingâ€ â†’ â€œI do important things at my own pace.â€ ğŸ”„

  1. Feel the new setting with your body â€” straighten up, take a deep breath.
  2. Repeat as an affirmation.

strakhi.title: Fears
strakhi.text:
Taking it to the Worst-Case Scenario ğŸ§ 

Goal: to reduce fear by realizing that the worst-case scenario can be handled.

Steps:

  1. Formulate the fear. For example: â€œI'm afraid of failing the interview.â€
  2. Imagine the worst outcome. For example: â€œI won't answer the questions, I won't be hired, I'll be left without a livelihood.â€
  3. Develop an action plan. Think about what can be done in this situation: â€œFinally, there will be time to pursue a hobby, dive into creating a blog, and earn much more.â€
  4. Accept that everything will be fine. Understand that any outcome can be the best.

Taking it to the Absurd ğŸ˜‚

Goal: to reduce anxiety by turning fear into a comical scenario.

Steps:

  1. Identify the fear. For example: â€œI'm afraid of being late for a meeting.â€
  2. Exaggerate to the point of absurdity. Imagine: â€œI'll be 5 hours late, I'll be met with torches and pitchforks, put on the wanted list, shown on all channels, and I'll become a meme hero.â€
  3. Laugh at the situation. Understanding the ridiculousness of the scenario helps relieve tension.
  4. Return to reality. Realize that the real outcome is much less dramatic.

abv-avtomaticheskaya-mysl-baza-variant.title: ABC: Automatic thought â†’ Base â†’ Choice
abv-avtomaticheskaya-mysl-baza-variant.text:
• Ğ (automatic thought): What do I tell myself automatically?

Example: â€œI'm developing too slowly, others are already far aheadâ€

  • B (base): Where could this thought have come from?

â€œAt school, I was compared to other children. I often heard that I was lateâ€

  • C (choice/variant): How can I formulate this differently, with support?

â€œEveryone has their own pace. I'm moving forward, and that's what matters. My path is mineâ€

chto-mnoy-dvizhet.title: What Drives Me?
chto-mnoy-dvizhet.text:
Sit in silence and write down answers to these questions:

  1. Why do I do what I do?
  2. Is this a choice out of love, fear, a desire to prove something, or to be accepted?
  3. What would I do if no one was around?

ğŸ“ Helps distinguish the true â€œselfâ€ from roles, patterns, and expectations of others.

dialog-s-vnutrennim-kritikom.title: Dialogue with the Inner Critic
dialog-s-vnutrennim-kritikom.text:
1. Write down what the critic says.
    Write down the critic's phrases word for word:
  • â€œYou won't make itâ€
  • â€œYou are weakâ€
  • â€œYou won't succeed in anythingâ€

ğŸ“ Don't soften it â€” write it exactly as it sounds inside.

  1. Ask: why are you saying this?
    Now we ask the critic a question:

â€œWhy are you saying this to me?â€
â€œWhat do you want to achieve with this?â€
â€œWhat are you afraid of for me?â€

Almost always, behind the criticism lie:

  • fears (of being rejected, deceived, embarrassed)
  • a need for safety
  • a desire to avoid pain or failure

Example: I'm telling you "don't stick your head out" because I'm afraid you'll be humiliated again, as in the past.

  1. Answer from the position of an adult and kind â€œselfâ€.
  • â€œThanks for the concern, but now I can choose for myselfâ€
  • â€œI'm going my own way, even if I make mistakesâ€

ğŸ“ Speak with respect, but firmly.

  1. Write the dialogue in two columns.
  • You won't make it â€” I'm making it step by step
  • You are weak â€” I am soft but strong deep inside

ğŸ“ Write until you feel relief or an internal shift.

  1. Find an image for the critic (optional).
    Sometimes the critic is an internal parent, teacher, mother, or child who has adopted strict rules.

Ask yourself:

  • Who does it look like?
  • How old is it?
  • Where did it come from in me?

ğŸ“ This helps separate yourself from the critic and see that its words are not the truth, but an inherited program.

meditatsiya-dve-dorogi.title: â€œTwo Roadsâ€ Meditation
meditatsiya-dve-dorogi.text:
• Close your eyes and imagine one path (decision).
  • Imagine how you live with this decision: morning, day, feelings, body.
  • Then do the same with the second option.
  • Compare the sensations: where are you freer, calmer, more inspired?

ğŸ“ Useful when logic doesn't help, but there's a feeling of â€œsomething's not rightâ€.

pismo-sebe-iz-budushchego.title: Letter to Self from the Future
pismo-sebe-iz-budushchego.text:
Imagine yourself 3 years from now, when everything has turned out well.

Write a letter to yourself from this future:

  • how you managed
  • what qualities helped
  • heart you are proud of in yourself

chto-by-skazala-silnoe-ya.title: What Would the Strong â€œSelfâ€ Say?
chto-by-skazala-silnoe-ya.text:
• Close your eyes and imagine your best, mature version.
  • Ask it: â€œWhat do you say to me now?â€
  • Write down the answer as a letter from it.

ğŸ“ Works great for fears, doubts, and insecurity.

supermen.title: â€œSupermanâ€
supermen.text:
Stand up, spread your legs, hands on your hips, chest forward, chin slightly up.

Stand like this for 2 minutes, breathing deeply.

ğŸ“ Increases testosterone levels and lowers cortisol.

dlya-snizheniya-trevozhnosti.title: To Reduce Anxiety
dlya-snizheniya-trevozhnosti.text:
4-7-8 Breathing

Inhale for 4 sec â†’ hold for 7 sec â†’ exhale for 8 sec. Repeat 4 times.

ğŸ“ Helps to calm down quickly and fall asleep.

5-4-3-2-1 Grounding

Name: 5 things you see â†’ 4 you hear â†’ 3 you feel â†’ 2 smells â†’ 1 taste.

ğŸ“ Brings you back to the "here and now".

Box Breathing (4-4-4-4)

Inhale â€“ hold â€“ exhale â€“ pause: 4 sec each.

ğŸ“ Reduces stress, suitable for during the day.

Body Scan

Slowly move your attention from head to toe, noticing sensations.

ğŸ“ Relaxes and grounds.

Warmth in Palms

Rub your palms together, place them on your chest or stomach, breathe deeply.

ğŸ“ Returns focus to the body and warmth.

Hugging Yourself

Hug yourself tightly, rock back and forth, say: "I am here with you".

ğŸ“ Soothes when alone.

stul.title: The Chair
stul.text:
What to do:
Sit across from an empty chair and imagine that someone (or a part of yourself) is sitting there with whom there is unspoken tension.

Say aloud everything you want to express: resentment, gratitude, pain, or support.

Helps release tension, clarify feelings, and restore internal dialogue.ğŸª‘

zerkalo.title: The Mirror
zerkalo.text:
Look into your own eyes in the reflection and say kind, supportive words aloud:

â€œI am with youâ€, â€œYou are worthy of loveâ€, â€œYou are doing greatâ€.
Helps develop acceptance, confidence, and a warm connection with yourself.

How to choose supportive words ğŸ’¬

Ask yourself:

  • What is hard for me right now?
  • What am I doubting?
  • What am I waiting for from others, but can say to myself?
  • What words would you say to a loved one?

If you have no ideas, start with these phrases:

  • â€œI am here for you, even if...â€
  • â€œYou have the right to...â€
  • â€œYou are okay, even if...â€
  • â€œI am proud of you for...â€

Check your feelings.

Read aloud, listening and understanding. If it evokes emotions, it means it's working correctly.

spisok-zhelaniy.title: Wish List
spisok-zhelaniy.text:
ğŸ’« Write down everything you want from life: material, emotional, spiritual â€” without filter or judgment, write everything that comes to mind to hear your dreams, desires that haven't opened up yet or have been forgotten.

Minimum 100 wishes.

askeza.title: Asceticism (Askeza)
askeza.text:
This is a conscious rejection of pleasures, comfort, or habitual actions for the sake of internal growth, willpower, and purification of mind and body.

Examples of simple practices: âœ¨

  • Do not use social media for 1 day.
  • No sugar for a week.
  • Wake up at 6 AM for 3 days in a row.
  • Speak only when necessary for 1 day.
  • Total silence for 1 day.
  • Abstinence from any entertainment.
  • Do not talk about yourself or your opinion for 3 days, direct attention outward.
  • Give away something valuable that is dear to you, or stop using something expensive.

You can believe in the effectiveness of this method or not, but you can try it ğŸ˜„

But in fact, it works because when you give something, sell it, or exchange it, you get something in return. Or more simply â€” attention concentrates better.

kakaya-emotsiya.title: Which Emotion?
kakaya-emotsiya.text:
1. Stop and pay attention inward.
    Is there tension, tears, contraction, warmth, trembling?
  2. Ask yourself:
  • What happened?
  • How am I reacting to it?
  • What do I want to do â€” shout, run away, hug, cry?
  1. Use â€œemotion wordsâ€.
    Run through the list: anger, anxiety, resentment, sadness, joy, shame, gratitude, fatigue, falling in love...
    Note what is closest.
  2. Listen to the body.
    Emotions always speak through sensations: contraction is often anxiety, heat is anger, emptiness is sadness.
  3. Accept the emotion.
    Even if it's difficult â€” just name it and don't try to explain to yourself why it's bad and how quickly you should get away from it.

prinyatie-resheniy.title: Decision Making
prinyatie-resheniy.text:
Steps: âš–ï¸

  1. Calm down.

Pause, exhale, create internal silence.

  1. Formulate options.

Clearly write down all possible solutions.

  1. Ask yourself:

â€“ What do I really want?
â€“ What will happen if I choose this?
â€“ What will happen if I don't?
â€“ How will I feel in a week/month/year with this choice?

  1. Listen to the body.

Imagine each option â€” where is it easier, where does it contract?

  1. Take a step.

A decision is not necessarily final â€” it's just another step, everything can be adjusted.

budilnik-kak-ya.title: â€œHow Am I?â€ Alarm
budilnik-kak-ya.text: Throughout the day, set many alarms that will remind you to ask yourself: "how am I right now? what is my body feeling? what do I want?"

spisok-moikh-khoroshikh-kachestv.title: List of My Good Qualities
spisok-moikh-khoroshikh-kachestv.text: You need to write down your strengths (for example, kindness, courage, sense of humor) to strengthen self-confidence and see your inner support.

progulka.title: A Walk
progulka.text:
According to Dr. Wendy Suzuki, neuroscientist and professor at New York University, the easiest way to improve your brain health is to walk often.

â€œJust 10 minutes of walking, which anyone can do anywhere in the world, reduces levels of anxiety and depression,â€ she said.

trenirovat-emotsionalnyy-intellekt.title: Train Emotional Intelligence
trenirovat-emotsionalnyy-intellekt.text:
According to Suzuki and Barrett, it is vital for the brain to control its feelings, rather than the other way around. This is called emotional intelligence â€” a practice that involves training the brain to be more flexible when it comes to emotions.

â€œWhether you perceive distress as sadness or anger is not at all the same as perceiving it as the result of a hard week, and you just need to take a little care of yourself,â€ says Barrett.

Suzuki suggested practicing what she calls â€œjoy conditioningâ€ to feel more positive emotions. To practice this, a person should think about positive memories from the past and try to recreate the emotions they felt at that time.

pereformulirovka-problemy.title: Reframing the Problem
pereformulirovka-problemy.text:
Sometimes it's not about the problem itself, but how we describe it. The formulation can sound threatening, cause rejection, stupor, or internal protest. This prevents us from seeing solutions.

Try saying your problem aloud and listen to your bodily and emotional reactions. Which words cause tension, irritation, or fatigue?

Replace them with more neutral ones or those close in meaning, but not as â€œheavyâ€. This way you reformat the internal setting and turn on creative thinking.

Example:

Original formulation:
â€œI need to finally sort out my life.â€
Feelings: heaviness, guilt, pressure.

Reframing:
â€œI want to bring a little more clarity to my day.â€
Feelings: curiosity, calmness, manageability.

Or:
Instead of â€œHow to increase team efficiency?â€
â†’ â€œHow to make the team's work easier and more pleasant?â€

vzglyad-na-problemu-s-raznykh-tochek-zre.title: Looking at the Problem from Different Points of View
vzglyad-na-problemu-s-raznykh-tochek-zre.text:
Every problem is like a complex shape: from one perspective it seems flat, from another â€” three-dimensional. Our personal views, experiences, and habits limit perception. But if you consciously try on another role â€” you can unexpectedly find the key to a solution.

It is useful to imagine how this would be viewed by:

  • a child who has no stereotypes;
  • an old person for whom many things no longer matter;
  • a critic looking for flaws;
  • a friend who wants to help;
  • a businessman who sees only profit.

In marketing, for example, they don't come up with what to sell based on their own ideas, but first look through the eyes of the customer â€” what they need.

Example:

Problem:
â€œI'm not coping with my studies, everything is piling up, I'm a bad student.â€

Other points of view:

  • Through the eyes of a teacher: â€œThis student is trying, but he lacks a system. That means he can be helped, given a structure â€” and he will manage.â€
  • Through the eyes of a friend: â€œActually, you're doing a lot in parallel, you're just overestimating your strength. You need rest and support.â€
  • Through the eyes of yourself 10 years from now: â€œI learned a lot during that time. Then it seemed like a disaster, but it turned out to be important experience.â€

Conclusion:
The problem is not in inability, but in overload and lack of strategy. You can start with something simple: set priorities and ask for help.

perevorot-problemy.title: Inverting the Problem
perevorot-problemy.text:
We often focus on the desired result, ignoring possible obstacles. However, considering negative scenarios can help identify weak spots and prepare for them.

This approach is similar to the method of â€œparadoxical intentionâ€ in Viktor Frankl's logotherapy, where the patient is invited to imagine and even desire what they fear in order to reduce anxiety.

Applying this method allows you to:

  • Realize and work through fears.
  • Identify weak points in plans.
  • Develop strategies to prevent unwanted outcomes.
  • Thus, working through negative scenarios helps you better prepare and increase your self-confidence.

Example:

Goal: â€œI want to successfully pass the interview.â€

Question: â€œWhat could go wrong?â€

Answer: â€œI might forget important information, get confused, or not understand a question.â€

Solutions:

  • Prepare cheat sheets with key points.
  • Practice answering questions with a friend.
  • Learn stress management techniques.

sbor-fakty.title: Collecting Facts
sbor-fakty.text: In reality, there aren't many problems that people haven't solved before us. Therefore, it is sometimes useful to just collect facts about the problem. You can find ready-made algorithms for solving similar problems or just a valuable tip.

layfkhak-ot-eynshteyna.title: Einstein's Life Hack
layfkhak-ot-eynshteyna.text:
When a situation piles up like a snowball, it is important to pause the internal fuss and regain clarity.

First â€” a pause and conscious breathing to interrupt the flow of anxious thoughts. This helps stabilize the emotional state. Then three key questions are asked:

What could be a solution in this situation?

  • List all possible options â€” even the simplest or most unexpected ones.

What in this situation depends on me personally?

  • Separate your area of responsibility and what you cannot influence.

What can I do right now?

  • Take at least one concrete step â€” to feel control and start the process.

These questions allow you to come out of a stupor and move to action.

Example:
Situation: â€œI haven't received a reply to an important email for 4 days, I'm on the verge of panic.â€

What could be a solution? â€” Write again, call, contact another person, ask colleagues, wait another day.

What depends on me? â€” I can write a reminder email, I can call. But I cannot speed up someone else's reaction.

What can I do right now? â€” Prepare a reminder email and send it.

ekh-tak-zhalko.title: Oh.. so pity...
ekh-tak-zhalko.text: Don't waste time on regrets. Focus on the good decisions you've made, not the bad ones. You can start a daily journal of your negative thoughts â€œI hate my big bellyâ€ and then replace them with positive ones.
